NiDdHC3q3whf3uKXwyGR8Q.text: Great drunk food. I recommend getting mustard and fried onions on your sausage. The mustard makes the sausage and there is no extra charge for the onions (shallots).

ALzwW07A1DFmUim5Mdabcg.text: Sausages.  It's a fun word to say.  Sausages.  Sausages.  Brilliant.

4R8xsLoccpItB6MdxNb-Cg.text: Never been so confused when ordering food before! Ended up with far to much food and no idea how we got what we did. Order orginally came missing some food too and had to go and ask and staff just confused us even more. Will not return sorry

T7GhlLx5TslJhlUGplBPBw.text: At the risk of offending my German friends, I don't think German food will be storming the bastions of fine dining anytime soon. However, bratwurst, their signature street fast food does make for a satisfying snackIn keeping with the fast food philosophy, the menu is simple - a choice of 3 sausages with traditional accompaniments. Prices are reasonableIn Germany, bratwurst would sometimes be a late night snack to assuage late night munchies. In London, it's an option for a cheap lunch but I wouldn't travel for oneAt this price, give it a try. What's the wurst that could happen?

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

J9uLgLf7iqlmWvO_FDD3Kw.text: For some years, Herman ze German was a little and excellent wurst shop between Charing Cross and Embankment. However, in August 2013, Herman ze German upped their game and expanded into Soho. The second location in Old Compton Street is much bigger than the original shop and also features a few new items on the menu alongside the known food and drinks offerings that include great products like fritz-kola from Hamburg.With more space, the new location offers a different experience that goes far beyond the take-away snack appeal of the first location. It even features a toilet downstairs, and when I was there I could listen to funny sounds from the German version of Adventures of the Gummi Bears. That alone should be reason enough to come back.If you like hot dog, meat balls, schnitzel and fries, Herman ze German is a restaurant you should not miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Currywurst with fries.

CF6oRW5GeXusKA0sGPYFwg.text: Meh... ok sausage but really nothing special, the bread could have been fresher and it comes with no toppings whatsoever?? No mustard no onions no gherkin...you have to pay to add all of this. Service was a bit of a let down too with them charging me more than they should have (only by 1 pound, but still) and after I let them know they didn't even offer to refund me. I really wanted to love this place but sadly I don't think I'll be back

oR922dkJreN1lnPjrnsEUQ.text: Can't say I'm a huge fan of this place. The food is simple German fare, which I guess is the pull, and if you're a big fan of sausage and what have you then you might like this place more than I. The ambiance is spartan and sterile. The beer selection is lacking, esp for a German restaurant. Also, you can't buy a beer unless you buy food (this is due, I am told, to their licensing). You can kind of circumvent this requirement by purchasing extra gherkins for 50p.

31JJB7Wst8jUcZbJgNTgow.text: According to my German friend, this is the real thing. Their currwurst with fries will send you in spicy heaven and it's perfect to have with their true German lagers

6X-BO0PGmAia45-lya82Wg.text: This place is amazing. I love it. Such a fun place to eat. The place is small enough but there is extra seating upstairs (or was that downstairs?) They server traditional German food including schnitzel but they are famous for wurst! German sausage. You can choose from different types of sausage and toppings. I had currywurst chopped up and served with really good crispy fries. The also sell cool soda and German beer. Staff are super lovely too and the prices are so reasonable. Cannot wait to go back.

m_i7lk2kL_FjU91P4OrTYA.text: This is honestly some of the best wurst I've ever had. And I'm a man that loves his wurst. The prices are also great. I highly recommend ze Wilde Bock Roll special.

e40ISe3hJhDptPd6YkkBnA.text: Hermen ze German. I really enjoyed curry bratwurst and decided to upgrade to a double sausage for £2 which I thought was a very good deal, with fries and sauerkraut (which cost 50p extra) but it finished off the meal.  I would definitely recommend for you to try it and when I'm back in London I will be going back because it was value for money for this type of experience

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

k2MKuXy29kjAlX3XYUpZwQ.text: Ordered: Spicy sausage currywurst with fries and sauerkraut set, two german bottled beers.Price: 14.80GBPReview: Don't get me wrong - the food is actually pretty tasty, the sausage was spicy, and the currywurst was a strong, dense, flavourful sauce. I love sauerkraut and this one wasn't too bad either! HOWEVER, the price is a bit over the top. Maybe it was the beers that did the damage, but I wasn't full, nor was I interested in paying 2GBP for a larger sausage which they tried to up sell. I don't know - I certainly won't be back if I'm in Soho. I wish the price was a little less, or the portions would be bigger. Maybe I'm being greedy - but I hope that I'm not the only one that thinks along these lines...

2TPYU_SsYA3SgNxiB7lYpw.text: Not sure about this place. Got disappointed by the food somehow. Try the fried chicken that was ok and flavoured but the fries were bad. Service is friendly

9iLdnkqrDkqFn1kqwDs0Ag.text: I'm so glad they opened here in Old Compton Street. And I'm sure they'll make a ton of money here!If you're wondering if you should try this...DO IT!Tasty, fresh food in a trendy venue, and for not a lot of money.  I love this place!

WfXxv75v7QM-5Vyi6DfE9w.text: Went here for lunch with some friends from work. Service was pretty speedy, and the bratwurst tasted good. The menu is kept pretty simple (and quintessentially German) and the atmosphere when I went was relaxed and friendly.Nothing to write home about but the place seems nice enough for a quick snack.

ckcCXrS-A1GQr3T6EPPrhQ.text: This was a really fun place. We had our first white sausages here (they came out in a boiling water jar) and were really impressed with the staff.  They were super friendly, and mature when dealing with some assholes that were harassing a young woman while we were eating.  It helped that one of the workers looked absolutely Germanic (think of the large German guy from Gladiator - I think it must've been his son!).Overall, a really fun spot in the middle of a hip part of London (soho) that let us get some grub in us for cheap, and exposed us to some new flavors. Would definitely go back.

D-CmAtHigY7bJKNkPhj8qA.text: Ordered the Chicken Schnitzel which I think is a specialty of the Soho Branch.Really awful, like reheated, dried food that had been sitting under a heat lamp all day.Very disappointing.

TboqgArSJ7XrLY2Wn-Y-Sw.text: Affordable and tasty! Get so full and satisfying every time. would recommend to others especially those loves fries!

Vpk1TXAcAZ2MDEbbezBSMQ.text: Mmmmmm sausages! This is the newest branch of Herman ze German and it's good! There are lots of seats both upstairs and down. They even had a nice little bench out the front to sit and people watch which is always interesting Soho.It's a good cheap place to eat in soho. I had the currywurst and chips which was super tasty and only cost £5.45. They have lots of choice; different types of sausage whether you want it in a bun, without, with chips, etc. Good cheap place to eat in soho, would go back.

d49ivBSUu-Fw-Yo5ZDok6g.text: A better experience this time, the currywurst sauce is still a little too concentrated for my liking but everything was not over salty this time and the fries were fantastically crispy.

Q9wOiYlUitZ0NMnvJ15ygw.text: Ordered the currywurst and fries, was pretty good. I've never had currywurst before then though (and sadly did not get a chance to when I visited Germany a few weeks later) so not sure how authentic it was. I thought it was slightly pricey (and a little salty) for the amount they serve, but staff is pretty friendly though and I like the decorations. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but it's good for a quick bite or late-night snack.

m_5g_6wHyUlOaTYAFvrNkQ.text: My first visit at this location of Herman Ze German and it's even better than the other one. Lots of seating, a more organized ordering area, and table delivery! Delicious food - as expected and a great time.

RDU-dvhww1RYrB89j8bU1g.text: Looked around the area for something a little different.  Came across this place.  I had the pork snitzell.   It was a good stop for a quick lunch and beer.   Small menu, but everything was made fresh and service was fast.   I saw the saussages on the plate of the person at the other table, they looked great - a good size portion.  i will be having that next!

V__58ZFT4xjQpnBUAPuTGw.text: When you first walk its a friendly, upbeat atmosphere. The host that greats you at the register is very sweet providing  recommendations on what to order. The interior decorations are cool. In no time we had our food. I have a gluten intolerance so I had the wurst without a bun. It came with slices in it to where I could cut it easily. It's pretty straight forward, wurst and fries. Damn delicious and we will be making a reappearance. Plus their music is catchy.  I have to admit one wasn't really filling so next time I'll get two!

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

RxbSaL_UMLaF3S2PqToK9A.text: Got a medium size currywurst with pommes, quite delicious and filling - it might not be as good as you get in Germany, but let's be realistic.  The hot-index of the currywurst sauce are very much off (I got the second hottest and barely felt any heat out of it).  If you like spicy heat I'd go with the hottest.Service was super fast and price was totally reasonable, I'd recommend this if you have the craving.

K3ZYTPHf2QzoYiehMM3jow.text: great food. Nice decoration. Location is also awesome. But loud music! We went there 30 mins before their closing time and the music was very loud. we felt they are trying to repel customers with the music. Food portion was generous and nice

Ch3NJActsHAbQqa4iyqPOg.text: Amazing food, good prices, and nice atomosphere. I had the veganwurst, and whereas usually i am not a huge fan of fake meats, this was absolutely delicious. Went with my German friend, and got her approval. Will definitely be frequenting this restaurant more often.

-QNg9I9h8rtXMkRptJuNiA.text: I'm a big fan, but sort out your veggie stocks.Let me set the context, I probably go to HzG about once a week, I went on my own at first, now up to five or six of us go and it's a trek. We get the tube from Hyde Park Corner to Leicester Square and walk through China Town to get here, all during our precious lunch hour. The food is that good!If you're veggie, this is one of the few places you're going to get a realistic (read meaty) hot dog that isn't full of potato, sweetcorn and pea's, it's absolutely brilliant. The chips are crispy and on point every time and the condiments and drinks (Fritz Kola) are tasty (though drinks are expensive).My real gripe, and I really hope HzG read this review, is the stock levels of your veggie sausages. On three separate occasions now I've made this trek of a journey to be told "Ohh, we've just ran out" which is INFURIATING when we've rode the tube and looked forward to it the entire way.I'm not sure what the problem with the Veggie Wurst is, but it never happens with the regular Wurst, but regardless, every time it happens, five or six of us then leave and go to GBK on Frith Street. You're losing a fortune.So, lovely place, meaty dogs look amazing, veggie dogs I can vouch for, but buy a bloody chest freezer or something to keep the veggie's happy, and i'll up the star rating considerably!

y49cntwm6IVwflnBQBIGCA.text: I love German food- so was keen to try this place. Having been here twice now I feel comfortable giving a review. It's a good place to grab a quick meal. I appreciate the fact they have a vegetarian sausage option- truly I do. The only problem is it's very very dry and was on two separate occasions. Even when you add copious amounts of ketchup. The chain needs to review how the veggie sausages are being cooked and improve the end result. My husband who orders the meat version says the meat version is great on the contrary. When ordering toppings- the crispy onions are free which is great. Good selection of German beers and soft drinks and seating inside is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Veggie sausage before the ketchup.

xtWZt5AyZF7degJ7HdmPvw.text: great place to grab a beer and a sausage after shopping or touring.  Good prices and very tasty meat.  Friendly service, too.

suViwz8wf6zAKxt2RJjM_w.text: tl;dr get the fries, no matter what you do.No, seriously, I enjoy the hot dogs (I find them a little salty, but I'm going to try to avoid a double entendre...) but it's the fries I crave from good ol' HZG. They're crispy, they're crunchy, they're savoury, they're just. Ugh, now I'm craving them.Herman's got the market cornered on sausages in Soho (nah, I'm just gonna go there), at least as far as the edible variety go (you're welcome). They offer a surprisingly nice selection of proper dogs & sausages that remind me of the sort I grew up with in Central Europe in the early 80s (ok I was tiny, but what kid isn't a hotdog connoisseur), before things got heckin' overprocessed. HZG's meat is tasty, and you want it in your mouth. I can't compare to 'real' currywurst because I'm always a bit sketched by stalls, but HZG's curry on its own merits is okay. Okay as in I'll enjoy it once a year and then remind myself the curry is too sharply tomato-y (without anything to balance it), too heavy on the curry powder (read along with me: I love actual curry, and I know this is not meant to be that, but y'all need to step back from the shaky can), and not quite umami-heavy to balance the sausage. Now, maybe if you get the extra-nuclear variety you'll be too busy dealing with hellfire to care, but in the more modest heat levels I find there's just a lack in cohesion. Which is fine! It really is. I bet this stuff is fab for nursing your hangover.Verdict: You're paying for the location, because the amount of nosh you get for the price is only 'eh', even for Soho, considering this is properly fast food. The food is okay, but nothing will wow you. Get some fries, though. And get me some fries, while you're at it.

qhOJ38rhVC0PskNqrCLExA.text: Looking for food late one Saturday night in London, and found this German sausage place. We had the Bratwurst and Bratwurst on a bun, and was surprised by the good quality sausage and the sauce. Good atmosphere and was very busy on Saturday night. Disappointed that they ran out of fries that night. Overall recommend this place for a great bite and good quality German sausage!

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

Ktj9GDPBTTzFvpoA9G-b0A.text: I do like a long, hot sausage in my mouth and that's just what Herman supplied when I ordered the Currywurst and chips. Served with the "burner" sauce to spice things up, since the "hot" sauce isn't really up to its namesake, and topped with freshly sprinkled crispy onion particles for free; it made for a sehr lecker Deutsche meal. The Würste are of fine quality and seem authentic, while ordering at the counter and friendly staff make the whole experience very efficient indeed.The decor is decidedly German with a hint of hipster which makes for a pleasant atmosphere for a quick meal. The synthpop Lederhosen music, on the other hand, could have come from any decade and was on the brink of unpleasant.The price seemed a little steeper than I remembered last, but there is still value for money.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom. Currywurst

ts-78mjPP00RKvFVNH4UtA.text: I've been meaning to pay Herman Ze German a visit for a while. As I had an hour to spare whilst waiting on friends, I decided to give is a go yesterday.The interior is pretty basic, with wooden bench tables and bench chairs, with bare walls broken up with a bit of neon signage. The counter is at the far end, with again a basic mix of food choices. On my visit they were out of Curry Wurst and also out of cheese (not a good sign for early on a Saturday evening).I felt like a lite option (It's not the best place for that really). I went for the Wurst and Salad. I opted for the Guest Wurst, which was a mixture of beef, pork and garlic. I was really pleased as the wurst was really tasty. It came with ample salad. The salad also included small pieces of apple, which gave it a nice twist.The staff were very pleasant, although food seems to be the main driver here, and not service. I will definately come back, as I was to try the Chilli Wurst and the Curry Wurst. If you are looking for a fast food outlet, it a great change from a burger or burrito outlet. I'd say give it a go!

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

8bQZZM9zpx3mtUbVG_exDg.text: Herman ze German is a small fast food chain in London mainly serving hot dogs - or more precisely German sausage - along with schnitzels. As well as the dead giveaway name the menu exudes German - schnitzel, bratwurst, sauerkraut and German beers.  Sausages (of which there are 3 choices all made in Germany) are either served in a bun, with a salad or with chips however there are a few combo deals; hotdog, chips & drink or hotdog with a few chips. I went for the ze Wild Bock Roll; bockwurst (smoky pork), curry sauce (you can chose the heat), crispy onions, mayo and a few chips. For £6 I was very impressed - massive sausage, nice bun, delicious crispy onions, a tasty curry sauce (I went for mild as I am a bit of a wuss) and chips with a great curry seasoning which I was also chuffed with! With Herman ze German, a hot dog isn't just a hot dog - they definitely are the best I have had.

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

J3SB9TUVmy-rSsOMpR8o0Q.text: Ist bratwurst ist gut! If you fancy some tasty German sausage (with extraslike sauerkraut, crispy onions, fries, mustard), make your way to Soho .. Herman serves up some tasty, unpretentious fast food.

PSh0OR_ozW5a2A6vKozN4w.text: Came in here for a quick bite before a show and ordered the chicken schnitzel without the fries. They don't charge you less for this but they do make the salad extra large. The schnitzel itself for was very tender and had great flavours. It was a bit thicker than your regular German schnitzel but was still very delicious. The salad was a good balance of different greens, cucumber and some apple type thing which I loved! Service was average, friendly but not very talkative. You order up at the bar and then they bring your food over. The decor is pretty cool. I like the meat grinders hanging around the walls. Toilets were downstairs and were clean and tidy.

K6MWZAQao17XAwAXVyN9Ew.text: Herman ze German is always great when grandma comes for a visit. she loves 'schnitzel mit pommes' or 'bratwurst und sauerkraut'. bratwurst and currywurst are also available for vegetarians! the meat tastes awesome and the price is appropriate

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

-IXbOlzOOHap109Sg9mGmA.text: Their food is great, their bratwurst, bockwurst; are great with sides of fries and sauerkraut.You simply stroll in, place your order at the main counter and are given a table in the dining area and then friendly waiting staff come along and serve your table when your food is ready.Their hotdog buns can be more baguette than hotdog bun.The menus are only half of what makes Herman Ze German fun; the dining area is like a taste of Germany, like fixtures consisting of 1 tap for both hot and cold to a very wholesome decor with the dining tables and David Hasselhoff projected on to the wall downstairs / hidden away from the hustle and bustle of Soho upstairs.Excellent bathroom facilities downstairs which are also as German as can be. There is also a dining area on street level as well as outside seats.Their soft drinks were all German and I got to try Fritz-Kola here for the first time but it wasn't to my pallet and there were no American alternatives available.I wouldn't really recommend this for its wheelchair access either.

0M9s-Sm1NVJgX4xX2NmeAA.text: It's... a wurst. Nothing less nothing more. I mean, fine, ok but.... it's a wurst damn it! The idea of creating a fast food based on wurstel might be appealing, but I do not see it becoming one of my usual spots in Central London.Reasonable prices, reasonable food quality, several beers available and a full range of german soft drinks home made. For a small snack, give it a go at least once!PS: There is plenty of space downstair!

CTdZL5g3mxhQ7ZPUELGkAg.text: Well it is what it is guys! Fast food authentic german style.  Having had the same in Germany it is identical with the curry sauce being what it is, in my opinion better than what you would get here in the UK.Don't expect waiter service and 5 star restaurant, its FAST FOOD folks and does exactly what it says!

photos.caption: Photo of Herman Ze German - London, United Kingdom

e55V1rncF6A8bQfJ338egA.text: How have I only just tried this place out!? The wurst is pretty good - maybe just maybe on par with some of the ones I've had in Germany. The currywurst in particular is lovely. Service is friendly and quick. There's a good amount of seating inside but it's quite small and I can imagine it gets full quite a bit during the day and night.I'll be back here for some more drunk cheap eats though.

g03LnscjLG49iq4D2ZlOaQ.text: Yup, this hits the spot. I actually came here with a couple of friends and I guy I was seeing who we had previously dubbed Herman the German. Because he is German and we are so clever. Awkward. Just after a snack, we grabbed a couple of giant beers and a plate of fries smothered in mayo and ketchup. Oh man, that's the stuff. This really is a solid pre-drinking venue, especially if you can grab a table. My friend had the sausage with sauerkraut and it looked pretty decent. This place isn't cheap though and the staff are kind of rude. Also I think you have to order food, if you want to drink, which is an annoying rule.
